results.title: All the World's a Stage
results.brief_description: Follows the progress of three students from their auditions before John Houseman for the Drama Division at the famous Juilliard School for performing arts, through to rigorous training to become professional actors.

results.title: All the Rivers Run II
results.brief_description: This is a stunning sequel to the internationally acclaimed series of the same name. The once thriving riverboat trade has been hit hard by bad times with the shearers strike and the arrival of new roads and railways. Brenton, Delie and their three children are desperately battling the odds to simply earn a living on the river. Into their lives walks a mysterious stranger who is immediately drawn to Delie. Based on the novel by Nancy Cato. R Rated: PG

results.title: All the way up there
results.creator_credit: Gaylene Preston, Warrick Attewell and Valhalla Film Productions
results.brief_description: Bruce Burgess, a 24 year-old cerebral palsy victim, realises an impossible dream - to climb a mountain. He manages to achieve this with the help of Graeme Dingle, one of New Zealand’s best known mountaineers. Emphasises the need for individual self-fulfilment despite physical or other limitations Narrated by David Yerix.

results.title: All the rivers run [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ian Crawford, Hector Crawford and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: A story of love between a man, a woman and the river which bound them together. After being shipwrecked a young woman accepts her uncle’s offer of the chance to begin a new life at Echuca where she meets her future husband. Together, they start a business carrying cargo on the Murray River. An adventurous story set in the early days of white settlement on the Murray River. Based on the novel by Nancy Cato.

results.title: All the mornings of the world = Tous les matins du monde
results.creator_credit: Alain Corneau, Jean-Louis Livi, Paravision International, FR3 Films, SEDIF, DD Productions, Divali Films and Film Par Film
results.brief_description: An award winning production recounting the life story of master 17th Century musician M de Saint Colombe (Jean-Paul Marielle) and his brilliant protege, Marin Marais. Marais (Gerard Depardieu), reflects on his life as a student when he fell in love with his mentor’s eldest daughter Madeleine (Anne Brochet). Guillaume Depardieu portrays the young Marais. The musical score, costumes and settings are outstanding.

results.title: All the right stuff
results.creator_credit: Connie Littlefield, Mike Mahoney and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Join Brendan as he spends $200 of his disposable birthday cash on clothes, music and entertainment. He is just one of a large group that is an image marketers dream; young, impressionable, earning money from a low paying service job with money to burn. Whilst working his way in and out of well known brand name shops, he, as well as other teenagers, shop owners and adults, discuss the impact of advertising on them, how it influences their sense of being and consumer purchasing. They also share their thoughts for their future.

results.title: All that jazz starring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen
results.brief_description: Documentary film featuring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen performing live on stage interspersed with personal anecdotes by Kenny Ball about his life on the road as a jazz musician. The music is great, from dixieland to gospel, and includes the memorable “Midnight in Moscow” along with “When the Saints go marching in”, “We shall not be moved” and many other jazz favourites. No credits available.

results.title: All that jazz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bob Fosse, Robert A Aurthur and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Joe Gideon is a chain-smoking, pill popping workaholic obsessed with producing, directing and choreographing a Broadway musical while womanising and editing his latest film (actually Fosse’s own film “Lenny”). This semi-autobiographical musical drama is framed by Gideon’s conversations with a mysterious figure of nemesis the “Lady in White”. Following Gideon’s heart attack, the film assumes a surreal hallucinatory logic. Not only does Fosse borrow freely from the European classics “8 1/2” and “The Seventh seal” but he inverts the showbiz and life affirming “That’s entertainment” ethos of the traditional musical. Cast includes Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and John Lithgow. Awards: Winner, Best Art Direction, Costume Design, Editing, Best Score, Academy Awards, 1979.

results.title: All that heaven allows [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: A respected middle-aged New England widow (Jane Wyman) with two grown children becomes the victim of smalltown gossip when she rejects socially acceptable alternatives for the love of her gardener, a much younger man (Rock Hudson). Sirk uncovers something of the paradox of middle America in the fifties - gleaming surfaces masking a crisis in values - by using the elements of the woman’s melodrama from within to expose the confining complacency and emotional aridity of small town middle-class life. Cast also includes Agnes Moorhood, Virginia Grey, Gloria Talbot and William Reynolds.

results.title: All quiet on the western front
results.brief_description: Regarded as a landmark in American cinema, and a film which pioneered depiction of the “irony” of war. The directional quality has been compared with Eisenstein for its biting commentary and emotional outcry against war. Its bravura direction fixed in millions of viewers minds the image of youth in the trenches. Lead star, Lew Ayres, became a true-to-life conscientious objector of war after portraying its moving scenes.
